publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7723 Mr Frank McAveety: Scottish Enterprise Puts Commonwealth Games Legacy at Risk—That the Parliament is deeply concerned by reports that Glasgow’s 2014 Commonwealth Games legacy is under threat; is concerned that Scottish Enterprise is cutting 46% of support to six firms that are charged with driving forward urban regeneration in Scotland and that this will have a detrimental effect on the ability of Clyde Gateway to carry out Commonwealth Games legacy commitments, and urges the Scottish Government to intervene with Scottish Enterprise and request that it review the proposal to reduce funding commitments to Clyde Gateway and other urban regeneration companies in Scotland.
S3M-7723 Scottish Enterprise Puts Commonwealth Games Legacy at Risk (lodged on 17 January 2011) Jamie Hepburn*, James Kelly*, Charlie Gordon*
S3M-7723 Scottish Enterprise Puts Commonwealth Games Legacy at Risk (lodged on 17 January 2011) Irene Oldfather*

S3M-7723 Mr Frank McAveety: Scottish Enterprise Puts Commonwealth Games Legacy at Risk—That the Parliament is deeply concerned by reports that Glasgow’s 2014 Commonwealth Games legacy is under threat; is concerned that Scottish Enterprise is cutting 46% of support to six firms that are charged with driving forward urban regeneration in Scotland and that this will have a detrimental effect on the ability of Clyde Gateway to carry out Commonwealth Games legacy commitments, and urges the Scottish Government to intervene with Scottish Enterprise and request that it review the proposal to reduce funding commitments to Clyde Gateway and other urban regeneration companies in Scotland. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, James Kelly, Charlie Gordon, Irene Oldfather

S3M-7723 Mr Frank McAveety: Scottish Enterprise Puts Commonwealth Games Legacy at Risk—That the Parliament is deeply concerned by reports that Glasgow’s 2014 Commonwealth Games legacy is under threat; is concerned that Scottish Enterprise is cutting 46% of support to six firms that are charged with driving forward urban regeneration in Scotland and that this will have a detrimental effect on the ability of Clyde Gateway to carry out Commonwealth Games legacy commitments, and urges the Scottish Government to intervene with Scottish Enterprise and request that it review the proposal to reduce funding commitments to Clyde Gateway and other urban regeneration companies in Scotland. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, James Kelly, Charlie Gordon, Irene Oldfather
